etymologies: late 18th century. From French brûlé area of forest that has been destroyed or cleared by fire, area of swampland in which the trees have been destroyed or cleared by fire, specific use as noun of past participle of brûler to burn

definitions: In Canada, especially the north-west: an area of forest which has been destroyed or cleared by fire, typically characterized by charred tree stumps.
An area of swampland in which the trees have been destroyed or cleared by fire, typically in order to be utilized as land for farming.
